thread.title: President Xi treated to best of British pomp
thread.title_full: President Xi treated to best of British pomp

title: President Xi treated to best of British pomp
text:
There was a traditional welcome at Horse Guards Parade Richard Pohle/The Times 2 of 8 The Queen greeting President Xi Richard Pohle/The Times 3 of 8 President Xi and his wife Peng Liyuan got the red-carpet treatment Toby Melville/Reuters 4 of 8 People line the street with "I love China" T-shirts near Buckingham Palace Matt Dunham/AP 5 of 8 Supporters of the Chinese president await his appearance Peter Nicholls/Reuters 6 of 8 Protesters line The Mall in London ahead of the arrival of Xi Jinping John Stillwell/PA 7 of 8 Human rights protesters hold placards ahead of Mr Xi’s arrival Peter Nicholls/Reuters 8 of 8 Valentine Low Updated 37 minutes ago 
Magnificently choreographed, perfectly staged and safely removed – for the time being at least – from any embarrassing protests, the Chinese state visit began today with a traditional ceremonial welcome at Horse Guards Parade. 
President Xi Jinping and his wife Peng Liyuan were formally greeted at the official start of their four-day visit by the Queen and Duke of Edinburgh. 
Earlier the couple had been welcomed at the Mandarin Oriental Hotel by the Prince of Wales – whose views on human rights abuses in Tibet have not made him a friend of China – and the Duchess of Cornwall. 
The welcome on Horse Guards, Subscribe now
